description: The massive flagship of the Whitebeard Pirates, styled after a whale with a figurehead resembling Moby Dick from the classic novel.

keyEvents.event: Shanks boards the Moby Dick to meet with Whitebeard
keyEvents.significance: Site of the historic meeting between two Yonko

keyEvents.event: Shanks demonstrates Conqueror's Haki, causing crew members to faint
keyEvents.significance: First major display of Conqueror's Haki affecting multiple people

keyEvents.event: Sky-splitting clash between Shanks and Whitebeard
keyEvents.significance: First sky-splitting moment in the anime occurs on/near this ship

description: A major city built on water, famous for its shipbuilding industry and home to the Galley-La Company.

keyEvents.event: Franky Family learns they were excluded from official Enies Lobby report
Straw Hats learn their bounties will increase

keyEvents.significance: The birthplace of the Straw Hats' new ship

keyEvents.event: Straw Hats continue celebrating and shopping
keyEvents.significance: Shows the crew's downtime after the Enies Lobby incident

description: The premier shipbuilding company in Water 7, led by Iceberg. Known for producing the highest quality ships in the world.

keyEvents.event: Galley-La shipwrights join Franky and Iceberg in building the Straw Hats' ship
keyEvents.significance: The company's master craftsmen collaborate on creating the Thousand Sunny

description: The Holy Land where the World Nobles live and the seat of the World Government, located at the top of the Red Line.

keyEvents.event: Five Elders receive news of Shanks and Whitebeard meeting
keyEvents.significance: Shows the World Government's concern about Yonko movements
